intro: Cryptandra obovata, commonly known as the smooth cryptandra, is a shrub native to the south-western region of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, ovoid, smooth leaves that are typically grey-green in color. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, which are followed by woody, capsule-like fruits. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathlands and open woodlands. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
